00001 
00003 //                                                                            //
00004 //          UNCLASSIFIED  UNCLASSIFIED  UNCLASSIFIED  UNCLASSIFIED            //
00005 //                                                                            //
00006 //   Description of this module:                                              //
00007 //      Utility software that interpolates EGM 2008                           //
00008 //      geoid heights from one of NGA's geoid height grids.                   //
00009 //                                                                            //
00010 //      This interpolator loads the worldwide EGM 2008 grid upon              //
00011 //      instantiation, and it interpolates from the worldwide grid.           //
00012 //                                                                            //
00013 //      This interpolator gives exactly the same results as                   //
00014 //      the companion egm2008_aoi_grid_package's interpolator.                //
00015 //      However, this interpolator is faster when                             //
00016 //      users are requesting tens of thousands of geoid                       //
00017 //      heights at widely dispersed horizontal locations.                     //
00018 //                                                                            //
00019 //   Revision History:                                                        //
00020 //   Date         Name          Description                                   //
00021 //   -----------  ------------  ----------------------------------------------//
00022 //   19 Nov 2010  RD Craig      Release                                       //
00023 //   27 Jan 2011  S. Gillis     BAEts28121, Terrain Service rearchitecture    //
00024 //                                                                            //
00026   
00027 // This file contains definitions
00028 // for functions in the Egm2008FullGrid class.
00029 
00030 #include <fstream>
00031 
00032 #ifdef IRIXN32
00033 #include <math.h>
00034 #else
00035 #include <cmath>
00036 #endif
00037 
00038 #include "CCSThreadLock.h"
00039 #include "CoordinateConversionException.h"
00040 
00041 #include "egm2008_full_grid_package.h"

00045 namespace 
00046 {
00047    const int    BYTES_PER_DOUBLE = sizeof( double );
00048    const int    BYTES_PER_FLOAT  = sizeof( float );
00049    const int    BYTES_PER_INT    = sizeof( int );
00050 
00051    const double EPSILON          = 1.0e-15;  // ~4 times machine epsilon
00052 
00053    const double PI               = 3.14159265358979323;
00054 
00055    const double PIDIV2           = PI / 2.0;
00056    const double TWOPI            = 2.0 * PI; 
00057 
00058    const double DEG_PER_RAD      = 180.0 / PI;
00059    const double RAD_PER_DEG      = PI / 180.0;
00060 }

00069 
00070 Egm2008FullGrid::Egm2008FullGrid (void)
00071 {
00072    // November  19, 2010: Version 1.00
00073    // February  11, 2011: Version 1.01
00074 
00075    // This function implements the 
00076    // default Egm2008FullGrid constructor.
00077 
00078    int     status;
00079 
00080    // The base class constructor
00081    // initialized most data members.
00082 
00083    // Initialize grid pointer for proper
00084    // operation of derived-class functions .....
00085 
00086    _heightGrid     = NULL; 
00087 
00088    // Read entire worldwide EGM 2008 grid here .....
00089 
00090    status          = this->loadGrid();
00091 
00092    if ( status != 0 )
00093    {
00094       throw MSP::CCS::CoordinateConversionException(
00095          "Error: Egm2008GeoidGrid: constructor failed.");
00096    }
00097 
00098 }  // End of Egm2008FullGrid constuctor

00101 // ************************************
00102 // * Egm2008FullGrid copy constructor *
00103 // ************************************
00104 
00105 Egm2008FullGrid::Egm2008FullGrid 
00106    ( const Egm2008FullGrid&  oldGrid )          // input
00107 
00108 : Egm2008GeoidGrid( oldGrid )                   // base class initializer
00109 
00110 {
00111    // November 19, 2010: Version 1.00
00112 
00113    int     i;
00114    int     kount;
00115 
00116    // This function implements the
00117    // Egm2008FullGrid copy constructor.
00118 
00119    // The base class copy 
00120    // constructor handles many data members .....
00121 
00122    // Definition:
00123 
00124    // oldGrid:            The Egm2008FullGrid object being copied.
00125 
00126    // Copy the worldwide geoid separations .....
00127 
00128    try
00129    {
00130       _heightGrid       = NULL;
00131 
00132       kount             = _nGridRows * _nGridCols;
00133 
00134       _heightGrid       = new float[ kount ];
00135 
00136       for ( i = 0; i < kount; i++ )
00137       {
00138          _heightGrid[ i ] = oldGrid._heightGrid[ i ];
00139       }
00140    }
00141    catch (...)
00142    {
00143       oldGrid._mutex.unlock();
00144 
00145       throw MSP::CCS::CoordinateConversionException(
00146          "Error: Egm2008GeoidGrid: copy contructor failed");
00147    }
00148 
00149    oldGrid._mutex.unlock();  // Use CCSThreadMutex function in copy constructors
00150 
00151 }  // End of Egm2008FullGrid copy constuctor

00174 Egm2008FullGrid&
00175 Egm2008FullGrid::operator= ( const Egm2008FullGrid&  oldGrid )
00176 {
00177    // November 19, 2010: Version 1.00
00178 
00179    // This function implements the
00180    // Egm2008FullGrid assignment operator.
00181 
00182    // Definition:
00183 
00184    // oldGrid:            The Egm2008FullGrid object being assigned.
00185 
00186    int     i;
00187    int     kount;
00188 
00189    // This function implements 
00190    // the Egm2008FullGrid assignment operator.
00191 
00192    if ( this == & oldGrid )                                return ( *this );
00193 
00194    // Assign base class data members .....
00195 
00196    Egm2008GeoidGrid::operator= ( oldGrid );
00197 
00198    // Assign the worldwide geoid separations .....
00199 
00200    try
00201    {
00202       delete[] _heightGrid;   _heightGrid = NULL;
00203 
00204       kount             = _nGridRows * _nGridCols;
00205 
00206       _heightGrid       = new float[ kount ];
00207 
00208       for ( i = 0; i < kount; i++ )
00209       {
00210          _heightGrid[ i ] = oldGrid._heightGrid[ i ];
00211       }
00212    }
00213    catch (...)
00214    {
00215       _mutex.unlock();
00216       oldGrid._mutex.unlock();
00217 
00218       throw MSP::CCS::CoordinateConversionException(
00219          "Error: Egm2008GeoidGrid: assignment operator failed");
00220    }
00221 
00222    _mutex.unlock();  // Use CCSThreadMutex function in assignment operations
00223    oldGrid._mutex.unlock();
00224 
00225    return( *this );
00226 
00227 }  // End of Egm2008FullGrid assignment operator

00230 // *************************************************
00231 // * Find geoid height via 2D spline interpolation *
00232 // *************************************************
00233 
00234 int   
00235 Egm2008FullGrid::geoidHeight(
00236    int     wSize,                           // input
00237    double  latitude,                        // input
00238    double  longitude,                       // input
00239    double& gHeight )                        // output
00240 {
00241    // November 19, 2010: Version 1.00
00242 
00243    // This function computes 
00244    // geoid heights from a reformatted 
00245    // version of NGA's worldwide geoid-height grid.
00246    // It primarily uses BICUBIC-SPLINE INTERPOLATION, 
00247    // but it uses bilinear interpolation for small windows.
00248  
00249    // Definitions:
00250 
00251    // gHeight:               Interpolated geoid height (meters).
00252    // latitude:              Geodetic latitude (radians) at 
00253    //                        which geoid height is to be interpolated. 
00254    // longitude:             Geodetic longitude (radians) at
00255    //                        which geoid height is to be interpolated.
00256    // wSize:                 The number of grid points 
00257    //                        along each edge of the interpolation
00258    //                        window that surrounds the point of interest;
00259    //                        the interpolation window has wSize**2 grid points;
00260    //                        if wSize < 3, then the geoid height 
00261    //                        is computed using bilinear interpolation; the
00262    //                        maximum allowable wSize is twenty grid points;
00263    //                        typical window sizes are 4x4, 6x6, 8,8 etc;
00264    //                        EGM 2008 interpolations normally use wSize = 6.
00265 
00266    // i:                     Grid's latitude  index. 
00267    // j:                     Grid's longitude index.
00268    // oddSize:               A flag indicating whether the 
00269    //                        local interpolation grid's number
00270    //                        of (rows = column) is even or odd;
00271    //                        oddSize = true  ..... 
00272    //                           the number of rows = columns is odd,
00273    //                           where 3x3, 5x5, 7x7, 9x9, etc are
00274    //                           examples of grids with oddSize = true,
00275    //                        oddSize = false ..... 
00276    //                           the number of rows = columns is even,
00277    //                           where 4x4, 6x6, 8x8, 10x10, etc are
00278    //                           examples of grids with oddSize = false.
00279    //                        The associated indexing logic has two goals:
00280    //                        2) if oddSize = true, select the 
00281    //                           the local grid so that the point of
00282    //                           interest lies near the grid's center,
00283    //                        2) if oddSize = false, select the 
00284    //                           the local grid so that the point of
00285    //                           interest lies in the grid's central cell.
00286    //                        When oddSize = false, the interpolator will
00287    //                        obtain a numerically-most-trustworthy solution.
00288 
00289    try {
00290 
00291 //    MSP::CCSThreadLock  aLock( &_mutex );  // copy constructor locks thread
00292 
00293       const int           TWENTY = 20;
00294 
00295       bool                oddSize;
00296 
00297       int                 i;
00298       int                 i0;
00299       int                 iIndex;
00300       int                 iMin;
00301       int                 j;
00302       int                 j0;
00303       int                 jIndex;
00304       int                 jMin;
00305       int                 kIndex;
00306       int                 offset;
00307       int                 status;
00308 
00309       double              latIndex;
00310       double              lonIndex;
00311       double              temp;
00312 
00313       double              latSupport[ TWENTY ];
00314       double              lonSupport[ TWENTY ];
00315       double              moments   [ TWENTY ];
00316 
00317       // EDIT THE INPUT AND INITIALIZE .....
00318 
00319       gHeight = 0.0;
00320 
00321       if ( TWENTY != MAX_WSIZE )                           return( 1 );
00322 
00323       if ( wSize > MAX_WSIZE ) wSize = MAX_WSIZE;
00324 
00325       if (( latitude < -PIDIV2 ) || ( latitude > PIDIV2 )) return( 1 );
00326 
00327       // Rationalize the longitude .....
00328 
00329       while ( longitude <   0.0 ) longitude += TWOPI;
00330       while ( longitude > TWOPI ) longitude -= TWOPI;
00331 
00332       for (i = 0; i < TWENTY; i++)
00333       {
00334          latSupport[ i ] = lonSupport[ i ] = moments[ i ] = 0.0;
00335       }
00336 
00337       // If window size is less than three, compute
00338       // the geoid height using bilinear interpolation .....
00339 
00340       // (executes only when the interpolation window 
00341       //  is too small for bicubic spline interpolation)
00342 
00343       if ( wSize < 3 ) 
00344       {
00345          status = 
00346             this->geoidHeight( latitude, longitude, gHeight );
00347 
00348          if ( status != 0 )                                return( 1 ); 
00349 
00350          ;   /* Normal bilinear interpolation return */    return( 0 );
00351       }
00352 
00353       // Compute indices to the window's grid points .....
00354 
00355       // Roughly center the 
00356       // interpolation window at the station .....
00357 
00358       latIndex = 
00359          double( _nGridPad ) + ( latitude  + PIDIV2 ) / _dLat;
00360       lonIndex = 
00361          double( _nGridPad ) + ( longitude -    0.0 ) / _dLon;
00362 
00363       oddSize  = ( wSize != (( wSize / 2 ) * 2 ));
00364 
00365       if ( oddSize ) {
00366          i0   = int( latIndex + 0.5 );
00367          j0   = int( lonIndex + 0.5 );
00368 
00369          iMin = i0 - ( wSize / 2 );
00370          jMin = j0 - ( wSize / 2 );
00371       }
00372       else { 
00373          i0   = int( latIndex );
00374          j0   = int( lonIndex );
00375 
00376          iMin = i0 - ( wSize / 2 ) + 1;
00377          jMin = j0 - ( wSize / 2 ) + 1;
00378       }
00379 
00380       // COMPUTE BI-CUBIC SPLINE INTERPOLATION .....
00381 
00382       // Compute interpolation window's 
00383       // relative column coordinate at which the
00384       // first set of geoid heights will be interpolated ....
00385 
00386       temp    = 
00387          lonIndex - double( jMin ); // 0 <= temp <= (wSize - 1)
00388 
00389       // Interpolate a synthetic geoid height 
00390       // for each row within the interpolation window .....
00391 
00392       for ( i = 0; i < wSize; i++ ) 
00393       {
00394          iIndex = iMin + i;
00395 
00396          offset = 
00397             ( _nGridRows - iIndex - 1 ) * _nGridCols;
00398 
00399          // Load interpolation window's 
00400          // i-th row of tabulated geoid heights ..... 
00401 
00402          for ( j = 0; j < wSize; j++ ) 
00403          {
00404             jIndex        = jMin + j;
00405 
00406             kIndex        = jIndex + offset;  
00407 
00408             lonSupport[j] = _heightGrid[ kIndex ];
00409          }
00410 
00411          // Compute moments, 
00412          // interpolate the i-th row's geoid 
00413          // height at the longitude of interest, 
00414          // then load the i-th latitude support point .....
00415 
00416          status        = 
00417             this->initSpline( wSize, lonSupport, moments );
00418 
00419          if ( status != 0 )                                return( 1 ); 
00420 
00421          latSupport[i] = 
00422             this->spline( wSize, temp, lonSupport, moments ); 
00423       }
00424 
00425       // Compute interpolation window's 
00426       // relative row coordinate at which the
00427       // final geoid height will be interpolated .....
00428 
00429       temp    = 
00430          latIndex - double( iMin );  // 0 <= temp <= (wSize - 1)
00431 
00432       // Compute moments, and interpolate final 
00433       // geoid height at the latitude of interest .....
00434 
00435       status  = 
00436          this->initSpline( wSize, latSupport, moments ); 
00437 
00438       if ( status != 0 )                                   return( 1 ); 
00439 
00440       gHeight = 
00441          this->spline( wSize, temp, latSupport, moments );
00442 
00443       // The thread is unlocked by aLock's destructor;
00444       // this occurs even when exceptions are thrown.
00445 
00446    }  // End of exceptions' try block
00447 
00448    catch ( ... ) { gHeight = 0.0;                          return( 1 ); }
00449 
00450    return( 0 );  // Normal-return flag
00451 
00452 }  // End of function Egm2008FullGrid::geoidHeight
00453 
00454 
00455 // **********************
00456 // ** Hidden functions **
00457 // **********************
00458 
00459 // ************************************** 
00460 // * Interpolate EGM 2008 geoid heights * 
00461 // ************************************** 
00462  
00463 int   
00464 Egm2008FullGrid::geoidHeight(
00465    double  latitude,                        // input
00466    double  longitude,                       // input
00467    double& gHeight )                        // output
00468 { 
00469    // November 19, 2010: Version 1.00
00470  
00471    // This function, which is
00472    // exercised only when wSize < 3, uses
00473    // bilinear interpolation to find geoid heights.
00474 
00475    // Definitions:  
00476 
00477    // gHeight:               Interpolated geoid height (meters).
00478    // latitude:              GEODETIC latitude at which nominal
00479    //                        geoid height is to be computed (radians). 
00480    // longitude:             GEODETIC longitude at which nominal
00481    //                        geoid height is to be computed (radians). 
00482 
00483    // wSize:                 The local interpolation window's size:
00484    //                        normally wSize = 6 for EGM 2008 interpolations.
00485 
00486    // Thread locks are not needed here, because this function
00487    // can only be invoked from the bicubic spline geoidHeight function; the
00488    // thread locks, if any, reside in the bicubic spline's geoidHeight function.
00489 
00490    try {
00491 
00492       int           i1;
00493       int           i2;
00494       int           i3;
00495       int           i4;
00496       int           index;
00497       int           j1;
00498       int           j2;
00499       int           j3;
00500       int           j4;
00501       int           status;
00502 
00503       double        a0;
00504       double        a1;
00505       double        a2;
00506       double        a3;
00507       double        lat1;
00508       double        lon1;
00509       double        n1;
00510       double        n2;
00511       double        n3;
00512       double        n4;
00513       double        x;
00514       double        y;
00515 
00516       // EDIT THE INPUT AND INITIALIZE .....
00517 
00518       gHeight = 0.0;
00519 
00520       if (( latitude < -PIDIV2 ) || ( latitude > PIDIV2 )) return( 1 );
00521 
00522       while ( longitude <   0.0 ) longitude += TWOPI;
00523       while ( longitude > TWOPI ) longitude -= TWOPI;
00524 
00525       // COMPUTE THE SURROUNDING GRID POINTS' INDICES .....
00526 
00527       status  = 
00528          this->swGridIndices
00529             ( latitude, longitude, i1, j1 );
00530 
00531       if ( status != 0 )                                   return( 1 ); 
00532 
00533       i2      = i1;
00534       j2      = j1 + 1;
00535 
00536       i3      = i1 + 1;
00537       j3      = j2;
00538 
00539       i4      = i3;
00540       j4      = j1;
00541 
00542       // GET THE SURROUNDING GRID POINTS' GEOID HEIGHTS .....
00543 
00544       index   = 
00545          j1 + ( _nGridRows - i1 - 1 ) * _nGridCols;
00546       n1      = _heightGrid[ index ];
00547 
00548       index   = 
00549          j2 + ( _nGridRows - i2 - 1 ) * _nGridCols;
00550       n2      = _heightGrid[ index ];
00551 
00552       index   = 
00553          j3 + ( _nGridRows - i3 - 1 ) * _nGridCols;
00554       n3      = _heightGrid[ index ];
00555 
00556       index   = 
00557          j4 + ( _nGridRows - i4 - 1 ) * _nGridCols;
00558       n4      = _heightGrid[ index ];
00559 
00560       // INTERPOLATE GEOID HEIGHT AT THE POINT OF INTEREST .....
00561 
00562       // Set bilinear coefficients .....
00563 
00564       a0      = n1;
00565       a1      = n2 - n1;
00566       a2      = n4 - n1;
00567       a3      = n1 + n3 - n2 - n4;
00568 
00569       // Set first ( S/W ) corner's geodetic coordinates .....
00570 
00571       lat1    = 
00572          _baseLatitude  + _dLat * double( i1 ); // radians
00573       lon1    = 
00574          _baseLongitude + _dLon * double( j1 ); // radians
00575 
00576       // Set point coordinates relative
00577       // to the grid square's S/W corner .....
00578 
00579       // 0 <= x <= 1;             0 <= y <= 1.
00580 
00581       x       = ( longitude  - lon1 ) / _dLon;
00582       y       = ( latitude   - lat1 ) / _dLat;
00583 
00584       // Perform the interpolation .....
00585 
00586       gHeight = a0 + a1 * x + a2 * y + a3 * x * y;   // meters
00587 
00588    }  // End of exceptions' try block
00589 
00590    catch ( ... ) { gHeight = 0.0;                          return( 1 ); }
00591 
00592    return( 0 );  // Normal-return flag
00593  
00594 } //  End of function Egm2008FullGrid::geoidHeight 
00595 
00596 
00597 // ******************************
00598 // *  Read reformatted version  * 
00599 // * of NGA's geoid-height grid *
00600 // ******************************
00601 
00602 int
00603 Egm2008FullGrid::loadGrid( void )
00604 {
00605    // November 19, 2010: Version 1.00
00606    // February 11, 2011: Version 2.00:
00607    // the function name changed after code review
00608 
00609    // This function reads a reformatted version
00610    // of NGA's EGM 2008 worldwide geoid-height grid.
00611 
00612    // The grid data is arranged in latitude rows, 
00613    // with the northernmost rows first, and with the
00614    // geoid heights arranged west-to-east within each row. 
00615 
00616    // Thread locks are not needed here, because this 
00617    // function can only be invoked from the constructor;
00618    // the thread locks reside in the constructor.
00619 
00620    try {
00621 
00622       int            endRow;
00623       int            i;
00624       int            index0;
00625       int            index1;
00626       int            index2;
00627       int            j;
00628       int            k;
00629       int            kount;
00630       int            startRow;
00631 
00632       std::ifstream  fin;
00633 
00634       // INITIALIZE .....
00635 
00636       fin.open(
00637          _gridFname.c_str(),
00638             std::ifstream::binary | std::ifstream::in );
00639 
00640       if ( fin.fail() )                                    return( 1 );
00641 
00642       // READ AND STORE HEADER .....
00643 
00644       fin.read((char*) &_nGridPad,  BYTES_PER_INT );
00645 
00646       if (fin.fail()) { fin.close();                       return( 1 ); }
00647 
00648       fin.read((char*) &_nOrigRows, BYTES_PER_INT );
00649 
00650       if (fin.fail()) { fin.close();                       return( 1 ); }
00651 
00652       fin.read((char*) &_nOrigCols, BYTES_PER_INT );
00653 
00654       if (fin.fail()) { fin.close();                       return( 1 ); }
00655 
00656       fin.read((char*) &_dLat,      BYTES_PER_DOUBLE );
00657 
00658       if (fin.fail()) { fin.close();                       return( 1 ); }
00659 
00660       fin.read((char*) &_dLon,      BYTES_PER_DOUBLE );
00661 
00662       if (fin.fail()) { fin.close();                       return( 1 ); }
00663 
00664       // If needed, convert to LITTLE-ENDIAN representation .....
00665 
00666       #if LITTLE_ENDIAN
00667 
00668          this->swapBytes( &_nGridPad,  BYTES_PER_INT,    1 );
00669          this->swapBytes( &_nOrigRows, BYTES_PER_INT,    1 );
00670          this->swapBytes( &_nOrigCols, BYTES_PER_INT,    1 );
00671          this->swapBytes( &_dLat,      BYTES_PER_DOUBLE, 1 );
00672          this->swapBytes( &_dLon,      BYTES_PER_DOUBLE, 1 );
00673 
00674       #endif
00675 
00676       _dLat         *= RAD_PER_DEG;  // grid file stores these in degrees
00677       _dLon         *= RAD_PER_DEG;  // grid file stores these in degrees
00678 
00679       // Set derived parameters .....
00680 
00681       _nGridRows     = _nOrigRows + ( 2 * _nGridPad );
00682       _nGridCols     = _nOrigCols + ( 2 * _nGridPad ) + 1;
00683 
00684       _baseLatitude  =
00685          -PIDIV2 - _dLat * double( _nGridPad );     // radians
00686       _baseLongitude =
00687              0.0 - _dLon * double( _nGridPad );     // radians
00688 
00689       // READ AND STORE THE REFORMATTED GRID .....
00690 
00691       // (Recall that the reformatted grid
00692       //  a) doesn't have FORTRAN records' headers and trailers,
00693       //  b) does have padding around the original grid's periphery)
00694 
00695       _heightGrid    = NULL;
00696 
00697       _heightGrid    = 
00698          new float[ _nGridRows * _nGridCols ];
00699 
00700       if ( NULL == _heightGrid )                           return( 1 ); 
00701 
00702       index0         = 0;
00703 
00704       startRow       = _nGridRows - 1;
00705       endRow         = 0;
00706 
00707       for ( i = startRow; i >= endRow; i-- ) 
00708       {
00709          // Read row's geoid heights .....
00710 
00711          fin.read( 
00712             (char*) (&_heightGrid[ index0 ]), 
00713                ( _nGridCols * BYTES_PER_FLOAT ));
00714 
00715          if ( fin.fail() ) { fin.close();                  return( 1 ); }
00716 
00717          // If needed, convert to LITTLE-ENDIAN representation .....
00718 
00719          #if LITTLE_ENDIAN
00720 
00721             this->swapBytes( 
00722                &_heightGrid[ index0 ], BYTES_PER_FLOAT, _nGridCols ); 
00723 
00724          #endif
00725          
00726          index0 += _nGridCols;
00727       }
00728 
00729       fin.close();
00730 
00731    }  // End of exceptions' try block
00732 
00733    catch ( ... ) {                                         return( 1 ); }
00734 
00735    return ( 0 );  // Normal-return flag
00736 
00737 }  // End of function Egm2008FullGrid::loadGrid
